column1: 0705|five minutes after seven o'clock|He really couldn't believe that the old woman who'd phoned him last night would show up this morning
column2: as she'd said she would. He decided he'd wait until five minutes after seven o'clock
column5: and make every effort in the book to locate someone reliable.

column1: 0705|five after seven|Outside my window the sky hung low and gray. It looked like snow
column2: which added to my malaise. The clock read five after seven. I punched the remote control and watched the morning news as I lay in bed.

column1: 0705|7:05 A.M.|Ryan missed the dawn. He boarded a TWA 747 that left Dulles on time
column2: at 7:05 A.M. The sky was overcast
column3: and when the aircraft burst through the cloud layer into sunlight
column4: Ryan did something he had never done before. For the first time in his life
column5: Jack Ryan fell asleep on an airplane.
